title: Projected annual inflation rate in the United States 2010 to 2024
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Inflation rate, with a total of 15 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2018 to 2015.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2013 to 2010.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2024 to 2022.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2022 to 2020.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2020 to 2018.
Conversely, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 2015 to 2013.
gold: This statistic shows the annual inflation rate in the U.S. from 2010 to 2018 with additional projections up to 2024 . The data represents U.S. city averages . The base period was 1982 - 84 .
